body:
> As per the docs there does not seem to be any way to get/set the primary and secondary selections from the X11 clipboard.

That's correct. GLFW uses the CLIPBOARD selection, as it's the one most similar to the clipboard of other platforms. If I added functions for the PRIMARY and SECONDARY selections, they wouldn't map to anything useful on platforms other than X11.

rename.from: No way to get/set the primary and secondary selection from X11 clipboard
rename.to: No way to get/set the primary and secondary selection

body: Sure, but on X11 it is pretty important to be able to use the other selections. The ability to paste from and copy to the PRIMARY selection is widely used throughout the X11 ecosystem, usually bound to the mouse middle click to paste and select to copy. While I can appreciate it is not useful on other platforms, IMO, it is too important to leave out. Other cross platform toolkits, Qt, for example, include the ability to use it on X11, see https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qclipboard.html#Mode-enum
Now that I know about kitty, I think I understand this issue better. Still not sure if or how to address it, but I'll keep an eye out when implementing #275.

Meanwhile, does anyone know if there is a work-around to set the primary selection?
Eg. using a different API/library, based on a GLFW-created window?

(My motivation is that I need primary selection support in mupdf-gl, which is based on GLFW).
Just use a program like xsel. Look in the kitty source code for an example.
Ah, I see, nice idea. Thanks for the pointer!

I ended up implementing a facility in GLFW for accessing the X11 primary selection:

https://github.com/knielsen/glfw/commit/045fc5780edd215ddac70d0aad715854ac4ebd5d

The patch itself is very straight-forward, it's just plumbing to get PRIMARY down to X11 instead of CLIPBOARD. The real question here probably is whether something like this is too X11 platform specific to be included, or if it is sufficiently useful on X11 (and others, like wayland?) to be included.

In any case, if there is interest in something like this, I'm happy to create a pull request.
@knielsen Thanks for the implementation. IMO since this is completely X11 specific, the function belongs in `glfw3native.h`, rather than the main API.

From this, it seems Wayland might also have it:

  https://wiki.gnome.org/Initiatives/Wayland/PrimarySelection

So wayland support might be added later.

It might make sense that the functions are available on all platforms. Then applications can be written to support selection on platforms where it is available. On platforms without selection, the selection will just be unavailable.

That being said, I'm happy to put it in the native API if that is preferable.

issue.title: Implement access to primary selection

repository.name: glfw
repository.description: A multi-platform library for OpenGL, OpenGL ES, Vulkan, window and input

issue.body:
This patch implements the access to X11 primary selection that was requested in issue #894.

New functions glfwSetSelectionString() and glfwGetSelectionString() are added similar to glfwSetClipboardString() and glfwGetClipboardString(). These functions do nothing on platforms with no X11-like primary selection.

There is some discussion in the issue 894 as to whether this is too X11 specific to be included in GLFW, or if it should perhaps be in the platform-specific api. Win32 does not have any similar concept to primary selection, to my knowledge. On the other hand, there are some references to primary selection in Wayland, eg. https://wiki.gnome.org/Initiatives/Wayland/PrimarySelection. So this might be non-X11 specific in the future.

In any case, I decided to create this pull request, which is rebased against latest GLFW master, in case it is useful.

I added stubs for other platforms; howver patch is currently only tested on Linux/X11 due to my lack of available other platforms.

Signed-off-by: Kristian Nielsen <knielsen@knielsen-hq.org>
